member.name: F:DIV2.Format.Exporter.Color.MAX_DAC_VALUE
member.summary: Max suported value in DAC format [0..63].

member.name: P:DIV2.Format.Exporter.Color.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get or set the component color value.
member.returns: Returns the component color value.

member.name: M:DIV2.Format.Exporter.Color.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.param: A 3 length array that contains the component values.

member.name: M:DIV2.Format.Exporter.Color.ToRGB
member.summary: Converts DAC values [0..63] to RGB range [0..255].
member.returns: Returns new value in RGB range [0..255]. In most of the cases, this value is an aproximation to the real RGB value.
member.remarks: DIV Games Studio and other software that works in old VESA modes, using the DAC format for colors instead of full RGB format. Use this function to adapt DAC values to RGB in order to work properly with modern implementations.

member.name: M:DIV2.Format.Exporter.Color.ToDAC
member.summary: Converts RGB values [0..255] to DAC range [0..63].
member.returns: Returns new value in DAC range [0..63]. In most of the cases, this value is an aproximation to the real DAC value.
member.remarks: DIV Games Studio and other software that works in old VESA modes, using the DAC format for colors instead of full RGB format. Use this function to adapt RGB values to DAC in order to work properly with DIV Games Studio.

member.name: M:DIV2.Format.Exporter.Color.Normalize(DIV2.Format.Exporter.ColorFormat)
member.param: Indicate the color range for set the normalization factor.
member.returns: Returns a with the componentes normalized.

member.name: M:DIV2.Format.Exporter.Color.IsDAC
member.summary: Is a valid DAC color value?
member.returns: Returns true if the RGB components are into the DAC range values [0..63].

member.name: T:DIV2.Format.Exporter.ColorPalette
member.summary: A representation of a 256 indexed color palette in DAC format [0..63].

member.summary: Get or set a value in DAC format [0..63].
member.returns: Returns the value.

member.summary: Creates a new palette from memory.
member.param: A 768 length array that contains the data of the 256 values.

member.summary: Creates a new palette from memory.

member.summary: Creates a new palette from memory.
member.param: A stream that contains the data of the 256 values.

member.name: M:DIV2.Format.Exporter.ColorPalette.ToRGB
member.summary: Gets a full RGB range values [0..255].
member.returns: Returns new array of full RGB values [0..255]. In most of the cases, this value is an aproximation to the real RGB value.

member.name: M:DIV2.Format.Exporter.ColorPalette.ToArray
member.summary: Gets the array from this instance.
member.returns: Returns new array of DAC values [0..63].
member.remarks: Use the function get a full RGB range [0..255] array.

member.name: M:DIV2.Format.Exporter.ColorPalette.Sort
member.remarks: This method try to sort the colors using the Nearest Neighbour algorithm, trying to ensure that the black color (0, 0, 0), if exists in palette, be the first color. This implementation is based on this article: https://www.alanzucconi.com/2015/09/30/colour-sorting/

member.summary: Number of color index entries in the range.

member.summary: Available ammount of colors for the range.

member.summary: Ammount of colors for the range.

member.name: M:DIV2.Format.Exporter.ColorRange.#ctor(System.Byte@)
member.summary: Creates a new instance with default values.
member.param: The start color index to setup the range.
member.remarks: By default, when initialize the 16 ranges in a , the idea is create a ramp values from 0 to 255 values and repeat until completes all 16 ranges. This process is automatically setup in default constructor.

member.param: A array that contains the data.

member.name: T:DIV2.Format.Exporter.ColorRangeTable
member.summary: A collection of 16 ranges that composes the table.
member.remarks: The color ranges are used only in DIV Games Studio color and drawing tools. Not are used in games. By default is enough to creates a with default values.

member.name: M:DIV2.Format.Exporter.ExtensionMethods.StringExtensions.GetASCIIZString(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get a binary representation of this in ASCIIZ format (ASCII null terminated string or C string).
member.returns: Returns a array with the content of the in ASCIIZ format. If the input string is shorter than the desired length, the string is filled with null chars. If the input string is longer than the length, getting a substring with the desired length.

member.returns: Returns a hash value.
member.remarks: Use this function instead of default to unsure that gets a unmutable hash code.
